data.title: Deli Lunch
data.text: This locally owned deli is a good place to enjoy soup, sandwich, or salads.  They offer daily specials as well.

data.title: Best Little Sandwich Shoppe Around
data.text:
A group of us go here annually for a 50's 'party'. The service is always great and the food is excellent. 
When you're in downtown Manteca make this a stop for lunch. The locals LOVE it. Even we out of towners drive 40 miles to eat there.

data.title: Tough pastrami sandwich, runny potato salad and bad service
data.text: I came early with a group and was told we had to wait for our table to be called to order... even a drink!   The girl behind the counter was unfriendly and rude!  When I finally was allowed to order, I pointed out it said my sandwich came with a 20 oz. drink on their chalkboard menu, but the girl behind the counter refused to give me the cup saying I had to use the tiny 2 oz. cup the hostess of our group brought for ambiance!  When she handed me my change, she motioned to the tip jar while asking if it was her tip!!  I put it in her jar to see if she would warm up a bit, but no, not even a "Thank You!"  My sandwich was brought out by the cook (I cannot imagine why there would only be two people working in the entire place - the girl behind the counter and the cook with a group as large as ours),  and the meat was so tough, I could not chew it!  The potato salad (which cost extra, came in a huge soup bowl instead of a traditional scoop with the sandwich, and was supposedly homemade, but it was watery and tasted like it came from a tub.  Sadly, I will not be back.

data.title: A Perfect Little Spot for Sandwiches
data.text: The Viallage Sandwich shop is a small, intimate place on a main ave of  downtown Manteca. They are very friendly and are extremely accommodating. We've had private parties there and they are so great. I always look forward to our gatherings here.
